701859f-a.title: Bronx: Starlight Park.
701859f-a.text:
Active Atheism
These huge caricatures of the Church & Czarisa, made by New York Communists, are like those constantly used in
Russian anti-religious Propaganda.
These grotesque figures may have meant a great deal to real grown- up red at a meeting in Starlight Park, the Bronx, in New York City, March 16th, 1930, but they were just amusing toys to the youngsters gathered about them. The figure at left represents the Church - (Rasputin, the Black Monk) and at right is Imperialism in figure of Nicholas - Czar of all the Russians.

NEG # 3207

701861f-a.title: Bronx: Starlight Amusement Park.
701861f-a.text:
Starlight Amusement Park (Bronx): The south end of the park showing the swimming pool and reservoir, seen from the E. 174th Street bridge over the Bronx River. The entrance to the park is on the south side of E. 177th Street, at Devoe
Avenue.
July 18, 1928

P. L. Sperr

701860f-a.title: Bronx: Starlight Amusement Park.
701860f-a.text:
Starlight Amusement Park (Bronx): Viewing east across the Bronx
River and the park's swimming pool.
P. L. Sperr  July 23, 1940
